messages.message:
CC: @Heymian @Serena @lydia

I'm not picky on the date myself, but I also don't do any UAT work, so I want to be sure to include the rest of eng mgrs as appropriate :slightly_smiling_face:

I did think a bit on code cut last week after rewriting the docs for it, specifically that we usually don't actually do the code cut until Monday afternoon / early evening.

I'd like to actually move that to an 'early Monday morning' cadence (still biweekly of course) so that UAT can begin first thing Monday PST. It's not an automated process yet, we can work that part out - but doing it earlier on code cut days seems like it would regain some of the UAT window that Wednesday certifications will lose.

:heavy_plus_sign: on code cut on early Monday morning

no strong opinion on the certification date - but if we do make these changes to code cut time and certification date, we should make sure to announce widely  to all engineers

Very much agree :slightly_smiling_face:

Code cut is announced each time anyway (or at least that's part of the documented steps lol), and if we do settle on a new date / time for certify we should be pretty loud about it and explain the associated code-cut expectation change.

I don't think moving it to Wed from Thurs makes much of a difference. I think the main thing to note is the Wed build in the middle of UAT week is going to be a half-baked/likely-buggy. So we need to ensure that if there's a pre-prod deploy, it needs to use the wed release from the week after, the exact same one that prod will get (which is the correct thing to do).
